title: Mina Jevtović
text:
Hi! Salut ! ¡Hola! Здраво!
I am a Postdoctoral researcher at the Basque Center on Cognition, Brain and Language (BCBL) in Spain, interested in spoken and written language processing in monolingual and multilingual populations. I love reading, stats and learning new languages and feel quite fortunate that my everyday job combines these three passions! If you share the same interests (or just want to chat about them) feel free to get in touch!


 Research interests

data analysis
Bayesian modelling
spoken and written language processing
multilingualism



 Education

PhD in Cognitive Neuroscience, BCBL, Spain
MSc in Cognitive Neuroscience of Language, BCBL, Spain
BSc in Psychology, University of Belgrade, Serbia

title: presentations
text:
oral
Jevtović, M., Antzaka, A., & Martin, C.D. (2022). How would you spell it? A cross-linguistic investigation of the role of orthography in auditory word learning | 22nd meeting of the European Society for Cognitive Psychology (ESCoP), Lille, France.
Stoehr, A., Jevtović, M., de Bruin, A., & Martin, C. D. (2022). Regressive phonological transfer in early bilingual Spanish-Basque learners of English | 12th International Conference on Third Language Acquisition and Multilingualism, Zagreb, Croatia.
Stoehr, A., Jevtović, M., de Bruin, A., & Martin, C. D. (2022). L3-to-L2 versus L3-to-L1 transfer in Spanish-Basque-English trilinguals: Evidence from phonetics and the lexicon | 4th International Symposium on Bilingual and L2 Processing in Adults and Children, Tromsø, Norway.
Jevtović, M., Stoehr, A., Klimovich-Gray, A., Antzaka, A., & Martin, C.D. (2021). The impact of phoneme-to-grapheme consistency on the production and perception of speech sounds in early Spanish readers | Oral presentation at the International Child Phonology Conference (ICPC2021), Virtual Conference.  Awarded the Excellent Student Oral Presentation Award   See the talk
Jevtović, M., Thierry, G., Savić, A.M., & Ković, V. (2016). Shifting between two scripts analogous to shifting between the two languages: a case of Serbian bi-alphabetism | Oral presentation at the 6th UK Cognitive Linguistics Conference (UK-CLC2016), Bangor, UK.
Jevtović, M., & Damnjanović, K. (2016). Inhibition of content in syllogistic reasoning | Oral presentation at the 12th Alps-Adria Psychology Conference (AAPC16), Rijeka, Croatia.


poster

Early readers’ knowledge of phoneme-to-grapheme correspondences affects speech sound processing | Poster presentation at the First Interdisciplinary Workshop on Phonology and Dyslexia, San Sebastián, Spain. See the poster here
Jevtović, M., Antzaka, A., & Martin, C.D. (2021). Orthographic skeletons: Do we constantly create orthographic representations of newly acquired spoken words? | Poster presentation at the 28th Annual Meeting of the Society for the Scientific Study of Reading (SSSR2021), Lancaster, UK.   See the interactive poster here
Antzaka, A., Jevtović, M., & Martin, C.D. (July, 2021). Learning written words in a first language: Is there an influence of the orthographic system of the second language? | Poster presentation at the 28th Annual Meeting of the Society for the Scientific Study of Reading (SSSR2021), Lancaster, UK. See the poster here
Jevtović, M., Stoehr, A., Antzaka, A., & Martin, C.D. (2020). The effects of orthographic consistency at different levels of speech processing in Spanish beginning readers| Poster presentation at the Cognitive Neuroscience Virtual Meeting, Davis, CA, USA. See the poster here
Jevtović, M., Beesley, T., & Luque, D. (2019). Testing the automaticity of predictiveness-driven attention: The effect of task difficulty | Poster presentation at the 31st International Conference of the Spanish Society for Comparative Psychology (XIII SEPC), Málaga, Spain. See the poster here
Jevtović, M., Duñabeitia, J.A., & de Bruin, A. (2018). How do bilinguals switch between languages in different interactional contexts? | Poster presentation at the 11th Conference on Multilingualism (COM2018), Ghent, Belgium. See the poster here
Jevtović, M., Ković, V., & Thierry, G. (2017). Tug of war between top-down and bottom-up processing in bi-alphabetism | Poster presentation at the 23rd Architectures and Mechanisms of Language Processing Conference (AMLaP2017), Lancaster, UK. See the poster here

title: publications
text:
Sharing is caring! All statistical and experimental scripts as well as stimuli and material I use in my studies are publicly available on my  OSF page 

2023
Jevtović, M., Antzaka, A., & Martin, C. D. (2023). Déjà-lu: When orthographic representations are generated in the absence of orthography. Journal of Cognition, 6(1), 7. DOI:  doi.org/10.5334/joc.250     Data and Code


2022
Jevtović, M., Stoehr, A., Klimovich-Gray, A., Antzaka, A., & Martin, C. D. (2022). One-to-one or one too many? Linking sound-to-letter mappings to speech sound perception and production in early readers. Journal of Speech, Language, and Hearing Research, 65(12), 4507-4519. DOI:  10.1044/2022_JSLHR-22-00131     Data and Code
Jevtović, M., Antzaka, A., & Martin, C. D. (2022). Gepo with a G, or Jepo with a J? Skilled Readers Generate Orthographic Expectations for Novel Spoken Words Even When Spelling is Uncertain. Cognitive science, 46(3), e13118. DOI: 10.1111/cogs.13118    Data and Code
Luque, D., Molinero, S., Jevtović, M., & Beesley, T. (2020). Testing the automaticity of an attentional bias towards predictive cues in human associative learning. Quarterly Journal of Experimental Psychology, 73(5), 762-780. DOI: 10.1177/1747021819897590


2020
Jevtović, M., Duñabeitia, J.A., & de Bruin, A. (2020). How do bilinguals switch between languages in different interactional contexts? A comparison of voluntary and mandatory language switching. Bilingualism: Language and Cognition, 23(2), 401–413. DOI: 10.1017/S1366728919000191   Data and Code

title: resources
text:
On this page I (will) share some useful resources for learning stats, mathematics, programming. As a cherry on top I will also gather some resources that helped me learn and reach native like proficiency in French and Spanish. Stay tuned!
